Let's look at VRSN fundamentals to see what the fair value is right now vs. the market price.First, let's look at growth numbers: Sales up 5.9% over the past five years and sales up 3.7% in the most recent quarter. Earnings are expected to increase by 8% over the next five years and 6.1% in the next quarter. Return on Equity is a negative 38%. This would normally translate into a relative p/e to the market (S & P 500) of a discount as the growth numbers are less than the market, but the stock has a 5 year relative p/e of 134%, meaning it normally trades at a 34% premium to the market. Using the consensus forward earnings estimate next year of $4.72 VRSN is actually trading at a premium of 63%. The S & P 500 has a one year forward P/E of 18 which we will use to calculate the fair value for VRSN:The fair value is 4.72 x 1.34 x 18 = $114Current market price is $139.VRSN's stock price is overvalued and can be expected to drop down to its fair value unless earnings increase substantially over the next few quarters.
